thread.title: ASUS Unveils Insane Smartphone That Takes 92-Megapixel Photos
thread.title_full: ASUS Unveils Insane Smartphone That Takes 92-Megapixel Photos

author: Jonathan Sawyer
title: ASUS Unveils Insane Smartphone That Takes 92-Megapixel Photos
text:
Visit the original post to see all 3 images from this gallery. 
Earlier today we highlighted some key specs from Samsung’s forthcoming Galaxy Note 8 , and now we’re back to take a look at yet another new smartphone. Enter the Asus ZenFone AR.
The Asus ZenFone AR focuses on the ever-popular VR trend, while subsequently making use of Google’s Tango and Daydream software. The phone’s processor, the Qualcomm Snapdragon 821, is also specifically designed to handle such a hefty workload.
Asus’ new smartphone is just the second device ever to include Google Tango, a 3D-mapping technology. Tango takes advantage of a set of three different cameras to enable motion tracking, depth, and room mapping, thus detecting how far the phone is from a wall, the distance between two points, or where it’s located inside a building.
In addition to Tango, the ZenFone AR features Google Daydream, allowing users to quickly convert the phone into a VR machine.
Asus also claims that the ZenFone has the highest resolution mobile camera sensor on the rear, thus combining four native 23-megapixel photos to create a single image, which they are ultimately calling a 92-megapixel “super resolution” photo. According to Asus, such a photo boasts four times the clarity and less noise than a standard HD photo.
For now, Asus has yet to reveal price details for the ZenFone AR, but expect a release to take place in Q2 of this year.
